A quick follow-up to my previous posting-
Instead of scanning at a high resolution in order to capture detail of your oshigata/rubbing,
perhaps you could try scanning lower dpi, and manipulating the brightness and contrast adjustments
to improve image detail.  In my career as an art conservator, we often manipulate images to bring
out faint signatures, underdrawings of paintings, etc that are originally of low contrast.
Also, make sure your scanner is set at black and white, rather than a multi-color selection.

-Doug Sanders
